definition: to wade/to be involved/to concern/to experience/to enter (classical)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Has forded your frivolous lens, I see the profound pupil.
sentences.chinese: 涉过你轻薄的镜片，我看到深邃的瞳孔。

sentences.english: North Koreans keep on wading the Tumen River.
sentences.chinese: 不过朝鲜人并未被吓阻，他们继续涉过图们江。

sentences.english: Andy rolled up his pants and then walked through the stream.
sentences.chinese: 安迪卷起裤管，然后涉过了小溪。

sentences.english: The soldier rode out of the ford with the scouts in advance.
sentences.chinese: 侦察兵先涉过浅滩，战士们跟着安然渡过。

sentences.english: The exercise will help you wade through the tidal wave of names you’re about to encounter.
sentences.chinese: 这样会帮你涉过你将遇到的名字的浪潮。

sentences.english: He splashed (his way) through the shallow water.
sentences.chinese: 他噗通噗通地涉过浅水。

sentences.english: If you decide to ford a stream, be extremely careful.
sentences.chinese: 如果已决定要涉过小溪，必须极度小心。

sentences.english: He took off his shoes and wade across the shallow gully.
sentences.chinese: 他脱下鞋子涉过了浅水沟。

sentences.english: He take off his shoes and wade across the shallow gully .
sentences.chinese: 他脱下鞋子涉过了浅水沟。

sentences.english: The cow went on till she passed the shallow channel of Cephisus and came out into the plain of Panope.
sentences.chinese: 那条牛涉过了刻非瑟斯浅峡，来到了帕诺蒲平原。

sentences.english: Sometimes we had to crawl along, sometimes we had to wade knee-deep through water and mud.
sentences.chinese: 我们时而猫腰而行，时而涉过水深及膝的泥浆。

sentences.english: Go on my life on the road, met to wade across the river.
sentences.chinese: 走在自己的人生道路上，遇到了无法涉过的河。

sentences.english: As they neared the grape hut, the patrol waded through an irrigation ditch.
sentences.chinese: 巡逻队涉过灌溉水渠，走近葡萄园小屋。

definition: to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to travel over land and water (idiom)
